intro: Rubus cretatus, commonly known as the hairy blackberry, is a species of brambles native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, fertile ground. Rubus cretatus is often found in woodland edges, hedgerows, and disturbed areas.
